@Vain1 wrote:

you’ve never initialized those variables.

and you shouldn’t loop through item_tradeable
it’s redundant and will loop too far.

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @StonedC0D3r StonedC0D3r
item.description:
@StonedC0D3r wrote:

Yeah that is what i tought a few posts earlier. But i added this into dropAllItems and nothing happened…

for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE.length; j++) { if (Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE[j] == itemID) { c.getItems().addItemToBank(itemID, itemAmount); c.sendMessage("@blu@[Your untradeable items has been sent to your bank]"); return; } }

This is what happens when i put it in the dropAllItems method:

I tried changing the itemID & itemAmount but it didn’t do anything after i did, so i’m geussing i did it wrong.

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you’re all editing the wrong methods…
there is no reason to remove the items, then re-add them.

edit the delete/drop AllItems() methods.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @StonedC0D3r StonedC0D3r
item.description:
@StonedC0D3r wrote:

Null Amount:

Post your applyDead and giveLife method.

Here you go:

[code]public void applyDead() {
c.respawnTimer = 15;
c.isDead = false;

	if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		//c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
		c.killerId = findKiller();
		Client o = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[c.killerId];
		if(o != null) {
			if (c.inFunPk())
				return;
			c.DC++;
			o.KC++;
			if (c.killerId != c.playerId)			
			if(o.connectedFrom.length() != c.connectedFrom.length()) {
			if (c.inFunPk())
				return;
			o.pkPoints += 3;
			o.specAmount= 10.0;
			o.sendMessage("@red@You leave your opponent dead, you win @bla@3@red@ Pk Points.");
			o.sendMessage("@red@Your special attack has been restored as an award!");
			o.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
			o.gfx100(436);
			o.updateRequired = true;
			o.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
			
			} else {
			o.sendMessage("Good job wasting your time. No PKP for the same IP address.");
			
			}
			
			c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
			if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
				o.duelStatus++;
			}
		}
	}
	c.faceUpdate(0);
	c.npcIndex = 0;
	c.playerIndex = 0;
	c.stopMovement();
	if(c.duelStatus <= 4) {
		c.sendMessage("Oh dear you are dead!");
	} else if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		c.sendMessage("You have lost the duel!");
	}
	resetDamageDone();
	c.specAmount = 10;
	c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
	c.lastVeng = 0;
	c.vengOn = false;
	resetFollowers();
	c.attackTimer = 10;
}

public void resetDamageDone() {
	for (int i = 0; i < PlayerHandler.players.length; i++) {
		if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
			PlayerHandler.players[i].damageTaken[c.playerId] = 0;			
		}		
	}	
}[/code]

[code]public void giveLife() {
c.isDead = false;
c.faceUpdate(-1);
c.freezeTimer = 0;
if (c.duelStatus <= 4 && !c.getPA().inPitsWait() && !c.getPA().isOwner()&& !c.getPA().isHidden()) { // if we are not in a duel we must be in wildy so remove items
if (!c.inPits && !c.inFightCaves() && !c.inFunPk() && !c.getPA().isOwner() && !c.getPA().isHidden()) {
c.getItems().resetKeepItems();
if((c.playerRights == 2 && Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) {
if(!c.isSkulled && !c.isInFala() && !c.isInArd()) { // what items to keep
c.getItems().keepItem(0, true);
c.getItems().keepItem(1, true);
c.getItems().keepItem(2, true);
}
if(c.prayerActive[10] || c.isInArd() && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastProtItem > 700) {
c.getItems().keepItem(3, true);

				}

if(c.isInArd() || c.isInFala()) { //
c.getItems().dropAllItemsPVP(); // drop all items
c.getItems().deleteAllItems(); // delete all items
}else{

c.getItems().dropAllItems(); // drop all items
c.getItems().deleteAllItems(); // delete all items

}

				if(!c.isSkulled && !c.isInFala() && !c.isInArd()) { // add the kept items once we finish deleting and dropping them	
					for (int i1 = 0; i1 < 3; i1++) {
						if(c.itemKeptId[i1] > 0) {
							c.getItems().addItem(c.itemKeptId[i1], 1);
						}
					}
				}	
				if(c.prayerActive[10] || c.isInArd()) { // if we have protect items 
					if(c.itemKeptId[3] > 0) {
						c.getItems().addItem(c.itemKeptId[3], 1);
					}
				}
			}
			c.getItems().resetKeepItems();
		} else if (c.inPits) {
			Server.fightPits.removePlayerFromPits(c.playerId);
			c.pitsStatus = 1;
		}
	}
	c.getCombat().resetPrayers();
	for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
		c.playerLevel[i] = getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[i]);
		c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
	}
	if (c.pitsStatus == 1) {
		movePlayer(2399, 5173, 0);
	} else if(c.duelStatus <= 4) { // if we are not in a duel repawn to wildy
		movePlayer(Config.RESPAWN_X, Config.RESPAWN_Y, 0);
		c.isSkulled = false;
		c.skullTimer = 0;
		c.attackedPlayers.clear();
	} else if (c.inFightCaves()) {
		c.getPA().resetTzhaar();
	} else { // we are in a duel, respawn outside of arena
		Client o = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[c.duelingWith];
		if(o != null) {
			o.getPA().createPlayerHints(10, -1);
			if(o.duelStatus == 6) {
				o.getTradeAndDuel().duelVictory();
				o.pcPoints += 1;
				o.sendMessage("You have gained 1 Rune Points for winning a duel");
			}
		}
		movePlayer(Config.DUELING_RESPAWN_X+(Misc.random(Config.RANDOM_DUELING_RESPAWN)), Config.DUELING_RESPAWN_Y+(Misc.random(Config.RANDOM_DUELING_RESPAWN)), 0);
		if(c.duelStatus != 6) { // if we have won but have died, don't reset the duel status.
			c.getTradeAndDuel().resetDuel();
		}
	}
	//PlayerSaving.getSingleton().requestSave(c.playerId);
	PlayerSave.saveGame(c);
	c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
	resetAnimation();
	c.startAnimation(65535);
	frame1();
	resetTb();
	c.isSkulled = false;
	c.attackedPlayers.clear();
	c.headIconPk = -1;
	c.skullTimer = -1;
	c.damageTaken = new int[Config.MAX_PLAYERS];
	c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @StonedC0D3r StonedC0D3r
item.description:
@StonedC0D3r wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:6, topic:529124”]I don’t know the exact method names for PI but why not do something like:for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE.length; j++) { if (Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE[j] == itemID) { /* * Apply dead, blah, blah, blah, sends the player back to respawn point. */ c.addItem(itemID, itemAmount); c.sendMessage("Your untradeable items have returned to your inventory."); } } You might need to create a new method (maybe you won’t), but just have it so it returns the items to the inventory after the player respawns.[/quote]

I could give it a try, cause it still doesn’t work :l
Where exactly do i put this one? applyDead, giveLife, dropAllItems, public void createGroundItem?

When i used this one:

for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE.length; j++) { if (Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE[j] == itemID) { c.getItems().addItemToBank(itemID, itemAmount); c.sendMessage("@blu@[Your untradeable items has been sent to your bank]"); return; } }
I added it into public void createGroundItem and it worked, but it duped the items.
They told me to put it in dropAllItems and when i do, nothing happens. The items just go on the ground…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

I don’t know the exact method names for PI but why not do something like:for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE.length; j++) { if (Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE[j] == itemID) { /* * Apply dead, blah, blah, blah, sends the player back to respawn point. */ c.addItem(itemID, itemAmount); c.sendMessage("Your untradeable items have returned to your inventory."); } } You might need to create a new method (maybe you won’t), but just have it so it returns the items to the inventory after the player respawns.

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Why not do something like:if (c.inWild() || (c.isSkulled || !c.isSkulled)) { int[] itemsToKeep { 0, 1, 2, 3, 69, 1337 }; for (int i = 0; i < itemsToKeep.length; i++) { c.getItems().keepItem(i, true); } }Have it loop through an array of item IDs instead of repeating basically the same code 20 times.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Keeping untradeables in inventory on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @StonedC0D3r StonedC0D3r
item.description:
@StonedC0D3r wrote:

Hi everyone, i’m wondering if this is possible? I’ve been trying for like 2 hours now. And haven’t got anything to work… Last thing i came up with is this… :

if(c.inWild() || (c.isSkulled || !c.isSkulled)) { // what items to keep c.getItems().keepItem(0, true); c.getItems().keepItem(1, true); c.getItems().keepItem(2, true); c.getItems().keepItem(10551, true); c.getItems().keepItem(10548, true); c.getItems().keepItem(6570, true); c.getItems().keepItem(7462, true); c.getItems().keepItem(6666, true); c.getItems().keepItem(628, true); c.getItems().keepItem(630, true); c.getItems().keepItem(1949, true); c.getItems().keepItem(11663, true); c.getItems().keepItem(11664, true); c.getItems().keepItem(11665, true); c.getItems().keepItem(8842, true); c.getItems().keepItem(8841, true); c.getItems().keepItem(8840, true); c.getItems().keepItem(8839, true); c.getItems().keepItem(8850, true); }

I’m not very good at coding, but atleast i tried… I’ve been searching on google, r-s, moparscape but really haven’t found anything that works… If anyone could help me out a bit, i’d appreciate it!
